docs.lead_paragraph: The following letter from Mrs. HARRIET BEECHER STOWE to Dr. WARDLAW, dated Dec 4. 1852. was read at the Second Annual Meeting of the Glasgow Female New Association for the Abolition of Slavery: DEAR SIR: I Was most deeply and gratefully touched by your kind letter, and by its certainly very unexpected contents.

docs.lead_paragraph: Trial of Wm. M. Doty for Perjury, SECOND DAY. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS--Wednesday--Before Hon. Recorder TILLOU, Aldermen BARD and WESLEY SMITH.--The People against Wm. M. Doty The trial of Doty, for alleged perjury in the Forres Divorce Case, was continued yesterday.

headline.main: Arrival or Gen. Pierce, President Elect, at the Astor House--His Health and request to be retired--Incidents of the Railway Trip from Boston to New-York.

docs.lead_paragraph: This morning, at about 12 1/2 o'clock, General FRANKLIN PIERCE, President Elect of the United States, arrived at the Astor House, accompanied by his Excellency, Gov. SEYMOUR, of Conn., and his Private Secretary, SIDNEY WEBSTER, Esq.
docs.abstract: In NY. on route to Washington
docs.snippet: This morning, at about 12 1/2 o'clock, General FRANKLIN PIERCE, President Elect of the United States, arrived at the Astor House, accompanied by his Excellency, Gov. SEYMOUR, of Conn., and his Private Secretary, SIDNEY WEBSTER, Esq.

headline.main: EMIGRATION.; Annual Report of the Commissioners of Emigration to the Legislature.
LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. From Washington--Scene between Hon. Geo. Briggs and the Postmaster-General--Nomination or Micon--Mail Contract--The Cabinet.

docs.lead_paragraph: There was quite a scene between Hon. GEROGE BRIGGS and the Postmaster-General, at the Department, on Saturday. Mr. BRIGGS called to present a petition, signed by the merchants and brokers of New-York, representing many millions of dollars, praying for the employment of swift steamers to bring the mails of the ocean steamships from Sandy Hook to the city.

byline.original: Special Dispatch to the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Dates from Havana are received, via Philadelphia, to the 10th inst. The health of Vice-President KING was improving, at last accounts. Ho was taking daily exercise, on foot, and hoped to be able to return by the 1st of April.
docs.snippet: Dates from Havana are received, via Philadelphia, to the 10th inst. The health of Vice-President KING was improving, at last accounts. Ho was taking daily exercise, on foot, and hoped to be able to return by the 1st of April.

headline.main: THE BOURBON QUESTION.; The Mystery of the Last Dauphin.

docs.lead_paragraph: FRIEDRICH BULAN is a most diligent explorer of the byways of history. In a recent book entitled Geheime Geschichlen and Rathselhafte Menschen, ("Secret Histories and Enigmatical personages,") he has presented a portion of the results of his researches.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Osprey has arrived here in four days and twenty-four hours from Havana, being the quickest passage on record. Her dates are to the 10th instant.
